column4: I'm about ready to just reinstall freaking windows. This is the worst installation experience I've ever had
what happened?
an hour ago I saw you ask 'ok I'm ready how do I start' next thing I know something is tough for the install?
nothing. It shows a progress bar for a while, then ejects the disc. Nothing installs.
what hardware? PC? Dell or Generic?  Laptop? What install CD you using?
Dell Inspiron 1100 (about 3 years old). I'm using a disc from the DL .iso (UofU server)
just got the .iso about two hours ago, so I know it's current
laptop ok awesome I use a latitude d620 and got it to work off install CDs
what exactly happens? boots into CD, you hit enter, then a progress bar, then reboot? please write as much details as you can

okay, so here's what happens... I boot from CD, and it loads the options screen. I choose the default first option (Start or Install Ubuntu), and it goes to a progress bar. After about two minutes of that, the screen flicks on and off several times, before ending up off, but with the machine running. If I do nothing, it sits there forever. If I tap the power button, the screen flicks...
I wonder if you can try dumbing-down to a lesser video-resolution
there's no option that I can find. Also, the error won't show up now... it just tells me to remove the disc, close the tray, and hit "enter". I do so and it turns off, not installed.
there are options like F2, F3, F4, etc - they show you how to dumb-down the resolution
can you try again - boot into CD menu, hit F1 - F6 to read the help info?
where's that disk formatting utility that someone mentioned earlier?
there HAS to be an option to lower resolution - can be done in the CD-installer's "boot command line" too
gparted? it will overwrite stuff so don't use it if you are afraid to lose all data.
It was already erased and rewritten several times by the guy who gave it to me. I don't really care.
hey man this is a last-ditch-fallback idea -- there's probably a local ubuntu community group in your area - I'm sure if you showed up with the inspiron, they'd have you rocking out in no time.
hmm. Don't know anybody here yet... where would Iook online?
can Ubuntu use the NTFS file system?
later on -- good luck -- you'll get it.
